intro: Rudgea leiocarpoides, commonly known as the golden rudgea, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to yellow. Its leaves are usually opposite and elliptical, with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Rudgea leiocarpoides is often found in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests and along stream banks.
